verses.kjv: Nebuchadnezzar the king, unto all people, nations, and languages, that dwell in all the earth; Peace be multiplied unto you.
verses.web: Nebuchadnezzar the king, to all the peoples, nations, and languages, who dwell in all the earth: Peace be multiplied to you.
verses.ct: King Nebuchadnezzar, to every people, nation, and language across the whole earth: May you have abundant peace.

verses.kjv: I thought it good to shew the signs and wonders that the high God hath wrought toward me.
verses.web: It has seemed good to me to show the signs and wonders that the Most High God has worked toward me.
verses.ct: I want to tell you about the signs and wonders that the Most High God has done for me.

verses.kjv: How great are his signs! and how mighty are his wonders! his kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and his dominion is from generation to generation.
verses.web: How great are his signs! How mighty are his wonders! His kingdom is an everlasting kingdom. His dominion is from generation to generation.
verses.ct: How great are his signs! How powerful are his wonders! His kingdom lasts forever, and his dominion continues from generation to generation.

verses.kjv: I Nebuchadnezzar was at rest in mine house, and flourishing in my palace:
verses.web: I, Nebuchadnezzar, was at rest in my house, and flourishing in my palace.
verses.ct: I, Nebuchadnezzar, was living comfortably in my house, enjoying the prosperity of my palace.

verses.kjv: I saw a dream which made me afraid, and the thoughts upon my bed and the visions of my head troubled me.
verses.web: I saw a dream which made me afraid; and the thoughts on my bed and the visions of my head troubled me.
verses.ct: Then I had a dream that terrified me. The thoughts that came to me in bed and the visions in my mind left me deeply troubled.

verses.kjv: Therefore made I a decree to bring in all the wise men of Babylon before me, that they might make known unto me the interpretation of the dream.
verses.web: Therefore made I a decree to bring in all the wise men of Babylon before me, that they might make known to me the interpretation of the dream.
verses.ct: So I issued a decree summoning all the wise men of Babylon to appear before me and interpret the dream.

verses.kjv: Then came in the magicians, the astrologers, the Chaldeans, and the soothsayers: and I told the dream before them; but they did not make known unto me the interpretation thereof.
verses.web: Then the magicians, the enchanters, the Chaldeans, and the soothsayers came in; and I told the dream before them; but they didn’t make known to me its interpretation.
verses.ct: The magicians, astrologers, Chaldeans, and soothsayers all came. I described the dream to them, but none of them could tell me what it meant.

verses.kjv: But at the last Daniel came in before me, whose name was Belteshazzar, according to the name of my God, and in whom is the spirit of the holy gods: and before him I told the dream, saying,
verses.web: But at the last Daniel came in before me, whose name was Belteshazzar, according to the name of my god, and in whom is the spirit of the holy gods. I told the dream before him, saying,
verses.ct: Finally, Daniel came before me — the one called Belteshazzar, named after my god — a man in whom the spirit of the holy gods dwells. I told him the dream:

verses.kjv: O Belteshazzar, master of the magicians, because I know that the spirit of the holy gods is in thee, and no secret troubleth thee, tell me the visions of my dream that I have seen, and the interpretation thereof.
verses.web: “Belteshazzar, master of the magicians, because I know that the spirit of the holy gods is in you, and no secret troubles you, tell me the visions of my dream that I have seen, and its interpretation.
verses.ct: "Belteshazzar, chief of the magicians, I know that the spirit of the holy gods is in you and that no mystery is too difficult for you. Here are the visions I saw in my dream — tell me what they mean."

verses.kjv: Thus were the visions of mine head in my bed; I saw, and behold a tree in the midst of the earth, and the height thereof was great.
verses.web: Thus were the visions of my head on my bed: I saw, and behold, a tree in the middle of the earth; and its height was great.
verses.ct: "These were the visions that came to me as I lay in bed: I looked, and there stood a tree at the center of the earth, and it was enormously tall.

verses.kjv: The tree grew, and was strong, and the height thereof reached unto heaven, and the sight thereof to the end of all the earth:
verses.web: The tree grew, and was strong, and its height reached to the sky, and its sight to the end of all the earth.
verses.ct: The tree grew large and strong. Its top reached up to heaven, and it could be seen from the ends of the earth.

verses.kjv: The leaves thereof were fair, and the fruit thereof much, and in it was meat for all: the beasts of the field had shadow under it, and the fowls of the heaven dwelt in the boughs thereof, and all flesh was fed of it.
verses.web: The leaves of it were beautiful, and it had much fruit, and in it was food for all. The animals of the field had shade under it, and the birds of the sky lived in its branches, and all flesh was fed from it.
verses.ct: Its leaves were beautiful, and it was loaded with fruit — enough food for everyone. Wild animals rested in its shade, birds nested in its branches, and every living creature was fed from it.

verses.kjv: I saw in the visions of my head upon my bed, and, behold, a watcher and an holy one came down from heaven;
verses.web: “I saw in the visions of my head on my bed, and behold, a watcher and a holy one came down from the sky.
verses.ct: "As I continued watching these visions from my bed, I saw a watcher — a holy one — come down from heaven.

verses.kjv: He cried aloud, and said thus, Hew down the tree, and cut off his branches, shake off his leaves, and scatter his fruit: let the beasts get away from under it, and the fowls from his branches:
verses.web: He cried aloud, and said this, ‘Cut down the tree, and cut off its branches! Shake off its leaves, and scatter its fruit! Let the animals get away from under it, and the fowls from its branches.
verses.ct: He called out in a loud voice: 'Chop down the tree and cut off its branches! Strip its leaves and scatter its fruit! Drive the animals out from under it and the birds from its branches.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless leave the stump of his roots in the earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of heaven, and let his portion be with the beasts in the grass of the earth:
verses.web: Nevertheless leave the stump of its roots in the earth, even with a band of iron and bronze, in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of the sky. Let his portion be with the animals in the grass of the earth.
verses.ct: But leave the stump and its roots in the ground, bound with a band of iron and bronze, out in the open grass. Let him be drenched with the dew of heaven, and let him live among the animals, feeding on the grass of the earth.

verses.kjv: Let his heart be changed from man’s, and let a beast’s heart be given unto him; and let seven times pass over him.
verses.web: Let his heart be changed from man’s, and let an animal’s heart be given to him. Then let seven times pass over him.
verses.ct: Let his human mind be taken from him and replaced with the mind of an animal, and let 7 periods of time pass over him.'

verses.kjv: This matter is by the decree of the watchers, and the demand by the word of the holy ones: to the intent that the living may know that the most High ruleth in the kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoever he will, and setteth up over it the basest of men.
verses.web: “ ‘The sentence is by the decree of the watchers, and the demand by the word of the holy ones; to the intent that the living may know that the Most High rules in the kingdom of men, and gives it to whomever he will, and sets up over it the lowest of men.’
verses.ct: "'This sentence has been decreed by the watchers and declared by the holy ones, so that every living person may know this: the Most High rules over every human kingdom. He gives authority to anyone he chooses — even the lowliest of people.'

verses.kjv: This dream I king Nebuchadnezzar have seen. Now thou, O Belteshazzar, declare the interpretation thereof, forasmuch as all the wise men of my kingdom are not able to make known unto me the interpretation: but thou art able; for the spirit of the holy gods is in thee.
verses.web: “This dream I, king Nebuchadnezzar, have seen; and you, Belteshazzar, declare the interpretation, because all the wise men of my kingdom are not able to make known to me the interpretation; but you are able; for the spirit of the holy gods is in you.”
verses.ct: "That is the dream I, King Nebuchadnezzar, had. Now, Belteshazzar, tell me what it means. None of the wise men in my kingdom could interpret it, but you can, because the spirit of the holy gods is in you."

verses.kjv: Then Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, was astonied for one hour, and his thoughts troubled him. The king spake, and said, Belteshazzar, let not the dream, or the interpretation thereof, trouble thee. Belteshazzar answered and said, My lord, the dream be to them that hate thee, and the interpretation thereof to thine enemies.
verses.web: Then Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, was stricken mute for a while, and his thoughts troubled him. The king answered, “Belteshazzar, don’t let the dream, or the interpretation, trouble you.” Belteshazzar answered, “My lord, may the dream be for those who hate you, and its interpretation to your adversaries.
verses.ct: Daniel, also known as Belteshazzar, stood speechless for a long time, deeply disturbed by his thoughts. The king said, "Belteshazzar, don't let the dream or its meaning frighten you." Belteshazzar replied, "My lord, I wish this dream applied to your enemies and its meaning to those who oppose you.

verses.kjv: The tree that thou sawest, which grew, and was strong, whose height reached unto the heaven, and the sight thereof to all the earth;
verses.web: The tree that you saw, which grew, and was strong, whose height reached to the sky, and its sight to all the earth;
verses.ct: The tree you saw — the one that grew large and strong, whose top reached to heaven and was visible across the whole earth,

verses.kjv: Whose leaves were fair, and the fruit thereof much, and in it was meat for all; under which the beasts of the field dwelt, and upon whose branches the fowls of the heaven had their habitation:
verses.web: whose leaves were beautiful, and its fruit plentiful, and in it was food for all; under which the animals of the field lived, and on whose branches the birds of the sky had their habitation:
verses.ct: with its beautiful leaves and abundant fruit, providing food for all, with wild animals sheltering beneath it and birds living in its branches —

verses.kjv: It is thou, O king, that art grown and become strong: for thy greatness is grown, and reacheth unto heaven, and thy dominion to the end of the earth.
verses.web: it is you, O king, that have grown and become strong; for your greatness has grown, and reaches to the sky, and your dominion to the end of the earth.
verses.ct: that tree is you, O king. You have grown great and powerful. Your greatness reaches to heaven, and your rule extends to the ends of the earth.

verses.kjv: And whereas the king saw a watcher and an holy one coming down from heaven, and saying, Hew the tree down, and destroy it; yet leave the stump of the roots thereof in the earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of heaven, and let his portion be with the beasts of the field, till seven times pass over him;
verses.web: “Whereas the king saw a watcher and a holy one coming down from the sky, and saying, ‘Cut down the tree, and destroy it; nevertheless leave the stump of its roots in the earth, even with a band of iron and bronze, in the tender grass of the field, and let it be wet with the dew of the sky. Let his portion be with the animals of the field, until seven times pass over him.
verses.ct: "Then you saw a watcher, a holy one, coming down from heaven and saying, 'Chop down the tree and destroy it, but leave the stump and roots in the ground, bound with iron and bronze, out in the open grass. Let him be drenched with the dew of heaven and live among the wild animals until 7 periods of time pass over him.'

verses.kjv: This is the interpretation, O king, and this is the decree of the most High, which is come upon my lord the king:
verses.web: “This is the interpretation, O king, and it is the decree of the Most High, which has come on my lord the king:
verses.ct: "Here is the interpretation, O king. This is the decree of the Most High that has been issued against my lord the king:

verses.kjv: That they shall drive thee from men, and thy dwelling shall be with the beasts of the field, and they shall make thee to eat grass as oxen, and they shall wet thee with the dew of heaven, and seven times shall pass over thee, till thou know that the most High ruleth in the kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoever he will.
verses.web: that you shall be driven from men, and your dwelling shall be with the animals of the field. You shall be made to eat grass as oxen, and shall be wet with the dew of the sky, and seven times shall pass over you; until you know that the Most High rules in the kingdom of men, and gives it to whomever he will.
verses.ct: You will be driven away from human society. You will live with the wild animals and eat grass like cattle. You will be drenched with the dew of heaven, and 7 periods of time will pass over you — until you acknowledge that the Most High rules over every human kingdom and gives authority to anyone he chooses.

verses.kjv: And whereas they commanded to leave the stump of the tree roots; thy kingdom shall be sure unto thee, after that thou shalt have known that the heavens do rule.
verses.web: Whereas they commanded to leave the stump of the roots of the tree; your kingdom shall be sure to you, after that you will have known that the heavens do rule.
verses.ct: The command to leave the stump and roots of the tree means this: your kingdom will be restored to you once you recognize that heaven rules over all.

verses.kjv: Wherefore, O king, let my counsel be acceptable unto thee, and break off thy sins by righteousness, and thine iniquities by shewing mercy to the poor; if it may be a lengthening of thy tranquillity.
verses.web: Therefore, O king, let my counsel be acceptable to you, and break off your sins by righteousness, and your iniquities by showing mercy to the poor. Perhaps there may be a lengthening of your tranquility.”
verses.ct: So please, O king, accept my advice: turn away from your sin by doing what is right, and from your wrongdoing by showing mercy to the poor. Perhaps then your peace and prosperity will continue."

verses.kjv: All this came upon the king Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.web: All this came on the king Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.ct: Everything Daniel described happened to King Nebuchadnezzar.

verses.kjv: At the end of twelve months he walked in the palace of the kingdom of Babylon.
verses.web: At the end of twelve months he was walking in the royal palace of Babylon.
verses.ct: 12 months later, the king was walking on the roof of his royal palace in Babylon.

verses.kjv: The king spake, and said, Is not this great Babylon, that I have built for the house of the kingdom by the might of my power, and for the honour of my majesty?
verses.web: The king spoke and said, “Is not this great Babylon, which I have built for the royal dwelling place, by the might of my power and for the glory of my majesty?”
verses.ct: He declared, "Look at this great Babylon that I have built as my royal residence by my own mighty power, for the glory of my majesty!"

verses.kjv: While the word was in the king’s mouth, there fell a voice from heaven, saying, O king Nebuchadnezzar, to thee it is spoken; The kingdom is departed from thee.
verses.web: While the word was in the king’s mouth, a voice came from the sky, saying, “O king Nebuchadnezzar, to you it is spoken: ‘The kingdom has departed from you.
verses.ct: The words were still on his lips when a voice came from heaven: "King Nebuchadnezzar, this message is for you: your kingdom has been taken from you.

verses.kjv: And they shall drive thee from men, and thy dwelling shall be with the beasts of the field: they shall make thee to eat grass as oxen, and seven times shall pass over thee, until thou know that the most High ruleth in the kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoever he will.
verses.web: You shall be driven from men; and your dwelling shall be with the animals of the field. You shall be made to eat grass as oxen. Seven times shall pass over you, until you know that the Most High rules in the kingdom of men, and gives it to whomever he will.’ ”
verses.ct: You will be driven away from human society. You will live with the wild animals and eat grass like cattle. 7 periods of time will pass over you, until you acknowledge that the Most High rules over every human kingdom and gives authority to anyone he chooses."

verses.kjv: The same hour was the thing fulfilled upon Nebuchadnezzar: and he was driven from men, and did eat grass as oxen, and his body was wet with the dew of heaven, till his hairs were grown like eagles’ feathers, and his nails like birds’ claws.
verses.web: This was fulfilled the same hour on Nebuchadnezzar. He was driven from men, and ate grass as oxen, and his body was wet with the dew of the sky, until his hair had grown like eagles’ feathers, and his nails like birds’ claws.
verses.ct: That very hour, the sentence was carried out against Nebuchadnezzar. He was driven away from people and ate grass like cattle. His body was drenched with the dew of heaven until his hair grew long like eagles' feathers and his nails became like birds' claws.

verses.kjv: And at the end of the days I Nebuchadnezzar lifted up mine eyes unto heaven, and mine understanding returned unto me, and I blessed the most High, and I praised and honoured him that liveth for ever, whose dominion is an everlasting dominion, and his kingdom is from generation to generation:
verses.web: At the end of the days I, Nebuchadnezzar, lifted up my eyes to heaven, and my understanding returned to me, and I blessed the Most High, and I praised and honored him who lives forever; for his dominion is an everlasting dominion, and his kingdom from generation to generation.
verses.ct: When the appointed time was over, I, Nebuchadnezzar, looked up toward heaven, and my sanity returned to me. I praised the Most High and honored the one who lives forever, whose dominion is an everlasting dominion and whose kingdom endures from generation to generation.

verses.kjv: And all the inhabitants of the earth are reputed as nothing: and he doeth according to his will in the army of heaven, and among the inhabitants of the earth: and none can stay his hand, or say unto him, What doest thou?
verses.web: All the inhabitants of the earth are reputed as nothing; and he does according to his will in the army of heaven, and among the inhabitants of the earth; and no one can stop his hand, or ask him, “What are you doing?”
verses.ct: Everyone on earth counts for nothing compared to him. He does whatever he wills among the armies of heaven and the people of earth. No one can hold back his hand or question him, saying, "What are you doing?"

verses.kjv: At the same time my reason returned unto me; and for the glory of my kingdom, mine honour and brightness returned unto me; and my counsellors and my lords sought unto me; and I was established in my kingdom, and excellent majesty was added unto me.
verses.web: At the same time my understanding returned to me; and for the glory of my kingdom, my majesty and brightness returned to me. My counselors and my lords sought me; and I was established in my kingdom, and excellent greatness was added to me.
verses.ct: At that same moment, my sanity came back, and my royal honor and splendor were restored to me. My advisors and nobles sought me out, and I was reestablished on my throne with even greater majesty than before.

verses.kjv: Now I Nebuchadnezzar praise and extol and honour the King of heaven, all whose works are truth, and his ways judgment: and those that walk in pride he is able to abase.
verses.web: Now I, Nebuchadnezzar, praise and extol and honor the King of heaven; for all his works are truth, and his ways justice; and those who walk in pride he is able to abase.
verses.ct: Now I, Nebuchadnezzar, praise, exalt, and honor the King of heaven. Everything he does is right, and all his ways are just. Those who walk in pride, he is able to humble.
